result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan L Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, straight time.

miscConds.notes:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan L Cruz

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and Elements

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: denying defendant's request for release privileges, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, MIsdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Reserve Branch 10, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties, defendant, and Gyna G.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-AODA assessment
-Mental Health Assessment
-Anger Management Classes
-Complete 20 hours of community service
-No contact with Sharline G., or Sonia M.
-Provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation or upon revocation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Bail on deposit to apply. 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and a letter on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Juan L Cruz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Defendant Juan L Cruz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan L Cruz in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, the motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Court ordered the defendant to go to the State Public Defender Office today.  If the defendant is eligible, the defendant is to return on the next court date.  If the defendant is NOT eligible, the defendant is to return to court today. Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM036486  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08-04-2015
Defendant Juan L Cruz in court with attorney Harrington.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case Recalled. Case set with pending matter for a Status Conference in branch 23.

Defendant Juan L Cruz in court with attorney Harrington.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised that defendant has an active arrest warrant on a related Case. Case passed.  Status conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan L Cruz in court with attorney Dawn Rablin for Torrie R. Williams.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense reqeusts another pretrial conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Court cancels stayed bench warrant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM028054  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-03-15
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sharline G.; and Sonja M.

Defendant Juan L Cruz in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 45  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/5/15 @ 1:30pm
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
